title: Key Insights and Themes Across RAG Literature
content:
MAJOR THEMES SYNTHESIZED FROM 10+ PAPERS:

1. ARCHITECTURAL EVOLUTION:
   - Basic RAG (2020): DPR + BART with marginalization over docs
   - Advanced RAG: Pre/post-retrieval optimizations, re-ranking, compression
   - Modular RAG: Flexible components, adaptive retrieval, self-reflection

2. RETRIEVAL INNOVATIONS:
   - Dense vs Sparse: Dense (DPR, Contriever) captures semantics; sparse (BM25) handles keywords
   - Hybrid approaches combine both for robustness
   - Unsupervised training via contrastive learning (Contriever)
   - Query optimization: rewriting, expansion, HyDE

3. GENERATION ENHANCEMENTS:
   - Fusion-in-Decoder: Attend to multiple passages simultaneously
   - Self-reflection (Self-RAG): Generate critique tokens for quality control
   - Corrective mechanisms (CRAG): Detect and fix retrieval errors

4. TRAINING PARADIGMS:
   - Joint training of retriever and generator (Atlas, RAG)
   - Distillation from LLM to retriever (REPLUG, LLM-Embedder)
   - Query-side only fine-tuning for efficiency

5. EVALUATION DIMENSIONS:
   - Retrieval: Recall@K, MRR, nDCG
   - Generation: Exact match, F1, faithfulness, citation accuracy
   - Holistic: FactScore, RAGAS framework

6. CRITICAL CHALLENGES:
   - Hallucination persists even with retrieval
   - Latency vs accuracy tradeoffs
   - Context window limitations
   - Attribution and verifiability

7. EMERGING DIRECTIONS:
   - Adaptive/on-demand retrieval (FLARE, Self-RAG)
   - Agentic RAG with tool use
   - Multimodal RAG
   - Privacy-preserving RAG for enterprise
